intro: Boesenbergia alba, commonly known as the white ginger or white boesenbergia, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like ginger and turmeric. The plant features long, narrow leaves and produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical characteristics of Boesenbergia alba make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and pharmacological study.
